sections.title: Leases
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 16.

items.question: Does the entity present right-of-use assets separately from other assets in the statement of financial position (or disclose in the notes)?
If the entity does not present right-of-use assets separately, does it include them within the same line item as that in which the corresponding underlying assets would be presented if owned?
If the entity does not present right-of-use assets separately, does it disclose which line items include those right-of-use assets?
Does the entity present lease liabilities separately from other liabilities in the statement of financial position?
If lease liabilities are not presented separately, does it disclose which line items include those liabilities?
In the statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, does the entity present interest expense on lease liabilities separately from the depreciation charge for right-of-use assets?
In the statement of cash flows, does the entity classify cash payments for the principal portion of lease liabilities within financing activities?
In the statement of cash flows, does the entity classify cash payments for the interest portion of lease liabilities applying IAS 7 requirements for interest paid?

In the statement of cash flows, does the entity classify short-term lease payments, low-value lease payments, and variable lease payments not included in lease liabilities within operating activities?
Does the entity disclose information about its leases (as lessee) in a single note or separate section of its financial statements?
Does the entity disclose the depreciation charge for right-of-use assets by class of underlying asset?
Does the entity disclose interest expense on lease liabilities?
Does the entity disclose the expense relating to short-term leases accounted for under IFRS 16.6?
Does the entity disclose the expense relating to leases of low-value assets accounted for under IFRS 16.6?
Does the entity disclose the expense relating to variable lease payments not included in lease liability measurements?
Does the entity disclose income from subleasing right-of-use assets?
Does the entity disclose total cash outflow for leases?
Does the entity disclose additions to right-of-use assets?
Does the entity disclose gains or losses arising from sale and leaseback transactions?
Does the entity disclose the carrying amount of right-of-use assets at period end by class of underlying asset?
If the portfolio of short-term leases at period end is dissimilar to that reflected in IFRS 16.53(c), does the entity disclose its lease commitments for short-term leases accounted under IFRS 16.6?
If right-of-use assets meet the definition of investment property, does the entity apply IAS 40 disclosure requirements?
If right-of-use assets are measured at revalued amounts under IAS 16, does the entity disclose the information required by IAS 16.77 for those assets?
Does the entity disclose a maturity analysis of lease liabilities separately from other financial liabilities?
Does the entity disclose qualitative information about the nature of its leasing activities necessary to meet IFRS 16.51?
Does the entity disclose exposure to future cash outflows not reflected in lease liabilities, including variable lease payments?
Does the entity disclose exposure from extension and termination options?
Does the entity disclose exposure from residual value guarantees?
Does the entity disclose exposure from leases not yet commenced to which it is committed?
Does the entity disclose restrictions or covenants imposed by leases?
Does the entity disclose information about sale and leaseback transactions?
If the entity applies IFRS 16.6 to short-term leases or low-value assets, does it disclose that fact?
If applying the practical expedient in IFRS 16.46A, does the entity disclose that it has applied it to all eligible rent concessions or, if not, the nature of the contracts to which it applied it?
If applying the practical expedient in IFRS 16.46A, does the entity disclose the amount recognised in profit or loss for changes in lease payments from those rent concessions?
Does the entity present assets held under finance leases as a receivable at the net investment amount?
Does the entity present underlying assets subject to operating leases in its statement of financial position according to the nature of the underlying asset?
For finance leases, does the entity disclose selling profit or loss?
For finance leases, does the entity disclose finance income on the net investment in the lease?
For finance leases, does the entity disclose income relating to variable lease payments not included in the net investment measurement?
For operating leases, does the entity disclose lease income, separately disclosing income from variable lease payments not dependent on an index or rate?
Does the entity disclose qualitative information about the nature of its leasing activities as lessor?
Does the entity disclose its risk management strategy for rights it retains in underlying assets?
Does the entity explain significant changes in the carrying amount of net investment in finance leases with qualitative and quantitative information?
Does the entity disclose a maturity analysis of lease payments receivable showing undiscounted lease payments on an annual basis for at least the first five years and a total for remaining years?
Does the entity reconcile undiscounted lease payments to the net investment in the lease, identifying unearned finance income and any discounted unguaranteed residual value?
For items of property, plant and equipment under operating leases, does the entity apply IAS 16 disclosure requirements?
Does the entity apply the disclosure requirements in IAS 36, IAS 38, IAS 40 and IAS 41 for assets subject to operating leases?
Does the entity disclose a maturity analysis of lease payments showing undiscounted lease payments on an annual basis for at least the first five years and a total for remaining years?
